original_title: Nexstar agrees to buy Tegna for $6.2 billion, a massive consolidation of local TV stations | CNN Business
article_summary: Nexstar, the largest US TV station owner, plans to grow further with the acquisition of Tegna, a $6.2 billion deal pending government approval. The move is based on expectations of loosened broadcast station ownership rules by the Trump administration, which could lead to more consolidation in the industry. Critics argue that such mergers could limit competition and reduce local news coverage.</s>
